section.title: Text Area: Tagging Level
section.p: Level 1: Elements that must be used to fulfill the DTA base format. These elements are consistently used in the DTA core corpus.
Level 2: Elements whose use acc. to DTA base format is recommended, but this is not necessary. These elements are used in all texts of the DTA core corpus.
Level 3: Elements that are contained in the DME base format but are not consistently applied in the texts of the DTA core corpus. The use of these elements is optional.
Level 4: Elements that are explicitly not included in the DTA base format. They should therefore be avoided in favour of the respective solution of the DTA basic format.

section.title: Text Area: Functional Categories
section.p: citations: Elements that identify quotations etc.
documentStructure: Elements that identify the structures of the original, which allow external access to the source.
drama: Elements that identify drama-specific text units.
editorial: Elements that identify editorial interventions.
floats: Elements that identify blocks that interrupt the body text at document or element level.
letter: Elements that identify letter-specific text units.
phraseStructure: Elements that specify the function or appearance of individual words or phrases.
tables: Elements that describe the structure of tables.
textStructure: Elements that specify the function or appearance of text passages within the entire text.
titlepage: Elements that describe text sections on the title page of a work.
verse: Elements that identify poetry-specific text units.

section.title: Text Area: Generic Attributes
section.p: @corresp: refers to corresponding internal elements or external objects ["#[xml:id]", "#[URI]"]
@next: refers to the successor in a multipart element ["#[xml:id]"]
@prev: refers to the predecessor in a multipart element ["#[xml:id]"]
@rend: describes the type of highlighting of a character string

@rendition: type of highlighting of a block ["#aq", "#b", "#blue", "#bottomBraced", "#c", "#et", "#et2", "#et3", "#f", "#fr", "#g", "#i", "#in", "#k", "#larger", "#leftBraced", "#red", "#right", "#rightBraced", "#s", "#smaller", "#sub", "#sup", "#topBraced", "#u", "#uu", "#v"]
@sameAs: refers to an element of identical content ["[xml:id]"]
@xml:id: element ID
@xml:lang: language code (ISO 639-3)

section.title: Header Area: Functional Categories
section.p: appearance: appearance of the text/original
authorTitle: bibliographic information on author and title
classification: content-related and formal classification of the text
names: names of persons, organizations and institutions
publication: circumstances of publication
responsibility: responsibility for editorial editing stations
sources: sources on which the full text is based
text: text structuring elements for entries in the TEI header

section.title: Header Area: Generic Attributes
section.p: @corresp: refers to a corresponding element ["#[xml:id]"]
@xml:id: element ID
@xml:lang: language code (ISO 639-3)
